concepts.description: Written program that describes how chemical hazards are evaluated and communicated to employees.
Process for categorizing chemicals based on physical, health, and environmental hazards.
Labels must include product identifier, signal word, hazard statements, precautionary statements, and supplier ID.
SDS must be available for each hazardous chemical and contain 16 standardized sections.
Training must cover chemical hazards, label reading, SDS usage, and protective measures.
